page.title: 07Housing in Stevington
page.content: There are approximately two hundred and nine properties ranging from early "listed" buildings right through to the latest timber frame construction. Very few properties reflect the owner's occupation.Those that do are the public houses,the shop,the Manse and the eight farms.An inn,the vicarage,the bakery,the off-licence and farm buildings have been converted to dwellings.Three farm houses are very modern,the others are the original buildings.There are seventeen bungalows,while the remaining residences are two, three or more bedroomed detached or semi-detached residences.Accommodation available to rent consists of four flats,five alm-houses,eight council houses and two other properties.One field and one plot have been sold for development.
